column1: Smoque BBQ////We didn't realize it was a counter service restaurant
column2: but we ended up liking it.  We got there about 6:45 on a Friday night and were through the line is less than 20 mins.  The line seemed to stay the same length while we were there
column3: but seating was definitely becoming a problem by 7:30.  When we go again we'll definitely aim to get there before 7
column4: and plan for a fairly short meal.  It is BYOB which is nice
column5: especially since beer is perfect for washing down smokey brisket.  The liquor store down the street sold mostly American macrobrews and Polish imports
column6: so my preference would be to bring beer rather than planning to pick it up when you're there.
